newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin up six cents to 14.34 ringgit/kg.
newsitem.headline: KL tin up six cents to 14.34 ringgit/kg.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price rose six cents to 14.34 ringgit ($5.44) a kg, with players again ignoring an overnight fall on the London Metal Exchange (LME), traders said.
They said a softer ringgit against the U.S. dollar was keeping players bullish on Malaysian tin.
"There was very good demand from Japanese, European and local buyers," said a trader.
Traders said the closing price was at par with the LME, after being at a discount of $10 a tonne on Tuesday.
At the opening, there were bids for 206 tonnes against offers for 125.
Final turnover was 206 tonnes, against 137 on Tuesday.
Traders pegged next resistance at 14.50 ringgit.
